title: How to Make Black Forest Waffles

steps.headline: Prepare your waffle iron.
steps.description: Preheat the waffle maker to a high setting and spray non-stick cooking spray over it.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients together.
steps.description: In a large bowl, whisk the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, and baking powder until well combined.

steps.headline: Add the wet ingredients and mix once.
steps.description: Combine the eggs, vegetable oil, buttermilk, and vanilla extract. Mix well with the whisk until fully combined and until there aren't many lumps.

steps.headline: Scoop the waffle batter onto the waffle iron.
steps.description: Use just enough waffle batter to fill the waffle iron.

steps.headline: Cook the waffles for about two to three minutes, following the cues of your waffle iron.
steps.description: Ensure that the waffles come out golden brown, puffed, and crisped on the sides. Set the waffles aside on a plate while you make the rest of the batch.

steps.headline: Garnish the waffles.
steps.description: Scoop a desired amount of cherry pie filling on top of the waffles. Sprinkle over the powdered sugar and chocolate syrup. Finish off by topping them with whipped cream.

text: Prepare your waffle iron. Preheat the waffle maker to a high setting and spray non-stick cooking spray over it. Mix the dry ingredients together. In a large bowl, whisk the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, and baking powder until well combined. Add the wet ingredients and mix once. Combine the eggs, vegetable oil, buttermilk, and vanilla extract. Mix well with the whisk until fully combined and until there aren't many lumps. Scoop the waffle batter onto the waffle iron. Use just enough waffle batter to fill the waffle iron. Cook the waffles for about two to three minutes, following the cues of your waffle iron. Ensure that the waffles come out golden brown, puffed, and crisped on the sides. Set the waffles aside on a plate while you make the rest of the batch. Garnish the waffles. Scoop a desired amount of cherry pie filling on top of the waffles. Sprinkle over the powdered sugar and chocolate syrup. Finish off by topping them with whipped cream. Serve and enjoy!
